conclusion: Consider principles of refraction and total internal reflection.
Refractive index of glass is n, air is approximately 1, critical angle is sin(θc) = 1/n.
Distance from center O to light source S is d.
For light to pass through without total internal reflection, angle of incidence must be less than critical angle.
Light ray emitted from S towards sphere surface, maximum angle of incidence when tangent to surface.
Angle of incidence θ related to sphere geometry: sin(θ) = √(R² - d²)/R.
For no total internal reflection: √(R² - d²)/R ≤ 1/n.
Rearrange to solve for d: d²/R² ≥ 1 - 1/n².
Final condition: d ≤ R√(1 - 1/n²) for light to pass through without total internal reflection.
